channel.title: Comments on: HTML5 Canvas Banner Ads with Greensock Tweening and TypeScript Tutorial

item.title: By: robert
item.dc:creator: robert
item.description: I totally understand because it was confusing to me too. Take a look at my <a href="https://codebelt.github.io/blog/typescript/arrow-function-typescript-tutorial/" title="TypeScript Arrow Function Tutorial" rel="nofollow">TypeScript Arrow Function Tutorial</a>.
item.content:encoded: I totally understand because it was confusing to me too. Take a look at my TypeScript Arrow Function Tutorial.

item.title: By: Clark
item.dc:creator: Clark
item.description:
Yes these => are a little confusing for me.
I see people define a method signature outside of the constructor.
Public onLoaded: () => void
Then populate that inside the constructor?
This.onLoaded = () => {} sorry my syntax is prob not exact. But if I do this for my class methods, what happens to my getter and setters? If getters reference "this" the class, why does onLoaded need => syntax but the getter does not?
item.content:encoded:
Yes these => are a little confusing for me.

I see people define a method signature outside of the constructor.

Public onLoaded: () => void

Then populate that inside the constructor?

This.onLoaded = () => {} sorry my syntax is prob not exact. But if I do this for my class methods, what happens to my getter and setters? If getters reference “this” the class, why does onLoaded need => syntax but the getter does not?

item.title: By: Payman T.
item.dc:creator: Payman T.
item.description: Good info. Your covering all the angles. I did want to note though for those who want to just bypass the coding part and visually crate banners visually (as you could do previously in Flash); you should check out Easy WebContent's Presenter. no coding ; just drag and drop with a full timeline ; http://www.ewcPresenter.com/ ; it's free to everyone.
item.content:encoded: Good info. Your covering all the angles. I did want to note though for those who want to just bypass the coding part and visually crate banners visually (as you could do previously in Flash); you should check out Easy WebContent’s Presenter. no coding ; just drag and drop with a full timeline ; http://www.ewcPresenter.com/ ; it’s free to everyone.

item.title: By: robert
item.dc:creator: robert
item.description: I haven't really looked into arrow functions but now that you showed me an example I will start playing with it. Thanks for the tip.
item.content:encoded: I haven’t really looked into arrow functions but now that you showed me an example I will start playing with it. Thanks for the tip.

item.title: By: esimov
item.dc:creator: esimov
item.content:encoded:
Why you are not using the new arrow function on:

this._image.onload = function() {
self.onImageLoad();
}

this._image.onload = e => {
this.onImageLoad();
}

This way you will preserve the scope of the outer execution context and it’s no need to bind the scope of the inner function to a variable “self” predefined outside. BTW some nice articles about TS.
